lead_paragraph: The Colorado Rockies, hoping to lock up Matt Holliday for the long term, settled for a two-year deal with him. Holliday agreed to a two-year, $23 million contract to avoid arbitration. He hit .340 with 137 runs batted in last season, the first player since 1967 to lead the National League in both categories.
